the production of too much saliva (= liquid) in the mouth: Pain is generally absent and hypersalivation may be the only symptom of the condition. On physical exam the patient had symptoms of hyper-salivation.
More examplesFewer examplesCommon symptoms include abdominal pain, hypersalivation, nausea, and vomiting. The drug is relatively contraindicated in those aged less than one year because of hypersalivation and the increased risk of adverse respiratory effects. Signs of insecticide poisoning may include vomiting, diarrhoea, hypersalivation, muscle tremors, and seizures.
